Good afternoon I'm Anna Soro from Palantir Finance team and I'd like to welcome you to our first quarter 2024 earnings call. We'll be discussing the results announced in our press release issued after the market Close and posted on our investor relations website. During the call we will make statements regarding our business that may be considered forward-looking within applicable Securities laws, including statements regarding our second quarter and fiscal 2024 results, Management's expectations for our future financial and operational performance and other statements regarding our plans, prospects and expectations. These statements are not promises or guarantees and are subject to risks and uncertainties which would cause them to differ materially from actual results. Information concerning those risks is available in our earnings press release distributed after the market closed today and in our SEC filings. We undertake no obligation to update forward-looking statements except as required by law. Further, during the course of today's call we will refer to certain adjusted Financial measures. These non-gaap Financial measures should be considered in addition to not as a substitute for or an isolation from Gap measures. Additional information about these non-gap measures, including reconciliation of non-gaap to comparable Gap measures is included in our press release and investor presentation provided today. Our press release, investor presentation and other earnings materials are available on our investor relations website at investors. palente here.com. Over the course of the call we will refer to various growth rates when discussing our business. These rates reflect year-over-year comparisons unless otherwise stated. Joining me on today's call are Alex karp chief executive officer, sham SAR Chief technology officer, Dave Glazer Chief Financial Officer and Ryan Taylor chief Revenue officer and chief legal officer. I'll now turn it over to Ryan to start the call. We started the year exceedingly strong with revenue of $634 million, an increase of 21% year-over-year driven by the momentum of AIP and our continued strong performance in US commercial. Our results also highlight the growing strength of our US Government business and our enduring Mission critical work. The continued interest in AI IP is loud and clear in the conversations I'm having across our customer base. We've shared our plans to capture the market with AIP and our results show that our strategy is not only succeeding, it is accelerating. While still early days our focus is on building the foundations of a long-term business. We intend to relentlessly continue Landing new customers and subsequently expanding those engagements as our products gain traction and have meaningful impact within Enterprises. Not only are we increasing the volume of new customers but I'm pleased with our ability to grow these new customers as well. With regards to Landing new customers we've sustained our high volume of boot camps with over 9915 organizations participating to date. To meet inbound demand we are also seeing substantial deal cycle compression. As one example a leading utility company signed a seven fig deal just 5 days after completing a boot camp. Another customer immediately signed a paid engagement after just one day of their multi-day boot camp and then converted to a seven figure Deal 3 weeks later. We expect the favorable unit economics and higher throughput to continue to accelerate our business. Us commercial is where we're seeing the greatest transformation. While q1 is seasonally our slowest quarter AIP adoption by new and existing customers helped Drive notable growth in customer acquisition and revenue in our us Commercial Business. In q1 we added 41 net new customers in US commercial. Our customer count increased 69% year-over-year and 19% quarter over quarter compared to 8% quarter over quarter growth in q1 2023. Excluding strategic Investments our us commercial Revenue soared by 68% year-over-year and 22% quarter over quarter. New customers span a variety of Industries as aip's applications seem endless from the largest independent Bottling Company in the US to a leading energy and infrastructure company and a multinational airline in q1 our us Commercial Business had customers from 56 of the 74 GX Industries. As we're Landing new customers we're also seeing those customers expanding their work with us across my conversations with customers I'm seen the recurring theme of them asking me how they can do more faster with Enterprise Transformations driven by AIP. We're showing them how they can move their AI strategy Beyond chat. Existing customers such as Los Cleveland Clinic and General Mills among others are realizing the extensive possibilities of AIP within their own Enterprises and increasing their scope accordingly. Lowe's accelerated its engagement from a starting point of no AI to utilizing production level AI for over 1,000 customer service agents resulting in a 75% reduction in overdue tasks. As one of its directors noted quote we achieved this in just four months and onboarded a thousand users within 3 weeks of rollout. Cleveland Clinic committed to a 10-year expansion deal to deploy more broadly across its hospitals. General Mills expanded the scope of its work further last quarter as its senior director noted quote we're saving on average about $14 million annually and it's really only deployed to part of our Network as we speak. We're seeing rapid expansions within key customer accounts for example a Fortune 500 Industrials company signed a three-year expansion deal which increased the annual revenue run rate of our work with them nearly fivefold compared to our initial engagement with them in 20 22 a Fortune 100 retail company started a pilot in Q2 2023 expanded to a use case conversion in August then expanded its work to a $12 million ACV Enterprise engagement last quarter. These are just a few examples more and more customers are expanding their work with us due to AIP and the incredible traction our software has within their organizations. Turning to our US Government business our Revenue continued to accelerate at last quarter increasing 8% quarter over quarter versus 3% quarter over quarter in Q4 with our products every day having critical impact on current world events we see continued demand for Mission manager and positive reception to first breakfast last quarter we were honored the US Army awarded pounder over $178 million to be the sole prime contractor to build a Next Generation targeting node under the program this marks the first time that a software company has won a prime contract for a hardware system and exemplifies pounder's position as the software Prime opening the door to vast New Opportunities. It is with immense reverence that we approach building and maturing our revolutionary capabilities for our war fighters. In our international government business We are continuing to ramp up the critical work for delivery of the UK NHS Federated data platform as well as providing defense capabilities to Allied Partners around the world. Looking at our business and its impact broadly I'm invigorated about the year ahead. We have never had more conviction about AIP and the power of our software as well as our continued efforts supporting the most critical missions around the globe. I'll now turn it over to Sham thanks Ryan the clear signal from AIP boot camps is that AI is for Builders so many anecdotes and quotes from customers all reinforcing the same point they are getting more done in a day or two in AIP than in a quarter or two without. We have pioneered the approach to getting Beyond chat and unlocking the value of llms in the Enterprise taking inherently unstructured inputs that are flying around the Enterprise be it emails slacks PDFs images comments audio and turning them into structured actions and outputs taking an email from a customer requesting a different product mix and turning it into an actual inventory allocation in the Erp system of record taking a health claims denial and programmatically generating the documentation and supporting evidence from the clinical records and contracts automating PNC insurance claims processing and even in government using Vision models to narrow candidate products driving foodborn outbreaks at CDC. And we have started rolling out build with AIP a series of developer and Builder oriented tutorials and reference implementations that enable Builders to ramp quickly on The Primitives and power of AIP and practical examples that unlock every employee at every customer. Our growth is being driven by the incredible dynamism of the US commercial market and we believe the US government will follow with this momentum. We have launched Builder boot camps in the US government. The US Army recently issued a memo identifying two paler systems aidp and army Vantage as is amongst the five total platforms approved for Builders. Our DOD customer recently hosted a hackathon showing the value of the open joint all domain command and control or Jad C2 SDK that we have been pioneering. We continue to invest in Mission manager and will be extending it to the edge with our Edge X infrastructure in US Government. It covers everything from streaming pipelines osdk backed applications native Gotham applications and third party apps. This was the third consecutive quarter of an expanding rule of 40 score. Turning to our Global Topline results we generated 634 million in Revenue in the first quarter up 21% year-over-year and 4% sequentially exceeding the high end of our prior guidance excluding the impact of revenue from strategic commercial contracts. First quarter Revenue grew 24% year-over-year and 4% sequentially. Customer count grew 42% year-over-year and 11% sequentially to 554 customers. Revenue from our largest customers continues to expand first quarter trailing 12-month revenue from our top 20 customers increased 9% year-over-year to 55 million per customer. Now moving to our commercial segment first quarter of commercial Revenue Drew 27% year-over-year and 5% sequentially to 299 million excluding impact from strategic commercial contracts. First quarter commercial Revenue grew 36% year-over-year and 4% sequentially. We had a very strong quarter of commercial bookings. First quarter commercial TC booked was 505 million representing 187% growth year-over-year. Our us Commercial Business continues to see unprecedented demand driven by momentum from AIP. First quarter us commercial Revenue grew 40% year-over-year and 14% sequentially to 150 million surpassing International commercial revenue for the first time excluding revenue from strategic commercial contracts. First quarter us commercial Revenue grew 68% year-over-year and 22% sequentially. AIP is driving both new customer conversions and existing customer expansions in the US. In the first quarter we booked 286 million of us commercial tcv representing 131% growth year-over-year. Total manying deal value in our us Commercial Business grew 74% year-over-year and 14% sequentially. Our us commercial customer count created 262 customers reflecting 69% growth year-over-year and 19% growth sequentially. We generated 149 million in international commercial Revenue in the first quarter representing 16% growth year-over-year but a 3% sequential decline as a result of continued headwinds in Europe and the revenue catchup in Q4 that we noted last quarter. We continue to capitalize on targeted growth opportunities in Asia, the Middle East and Beyond. Revenue from strategic commercial contracts was 24 million in the quarter. We anticipate second quarter 2024 revenue from these customers to decline to between 7 to 9 million compared to 19 million in the second quarter of 2023. We continue to anticipate 2024 revenue from these customers to be approximately 2% of full year Revenue. Shifting to our government segment first quarter government revenue grew 16% year-over-year and 3% sequentially to 335 million. First quarter US government revenue grew 12% year-over-year and 8% sequentially to 257 million. As Ryan noted we're excited to be the sole prime contractor under the Titan program and will continue pursuing other defense opportunities. We believe we're well positioned to see growth in our US Government business over the course of 2024. First quarter international government revenue grew 33% year-over year and declined 9% sequentially to 79 million as a result of the revenue catch-up in Q4 that we noted last quarter and continued headwinds in Europe. First quarter tcv booked was 94 million up 128% year-over-year. Net dollar retention was 111% an increase of 300 basis points from last quarter. The increase was driven both by expansions at existing customers and new customers acquired in q1 of last year. As net dollar retention does not include revenue from new customers that required in the past 12 months it does not yet fully capture the acceleration and velocity in our us Commercial Business over the past year. We ended the first quarter with 4.1 billion in total remaining deal value an increase of 22% year-over-year and 6% sequentially and 1.3 billion in remaining performance obligations an increase of 39% year-over-year and 5% sequentially. As a reminder RPO is primarily comprised of our Commercial Business as it does not take into account contracts with an initial term of less than 12 months and contractual obligations that fall Beyond termination for convenience Clauses both of which are common in most of our government business. Turning to margin and expense adjusted gross margin which excludes stock based compensation expense was 83% for the quarter. Adjusted income for operations which exclude stock-based compensation expense and related employer payroll taxes was 226 million representing an adjusted operating margin of 36% and marking the sixth consecutive quarter of expanding adjusted operating margins. q1 adjusted expense was 48 million up 2% sequentially and 2% year-over-year. Turning to the balance of the Year given our conviction in the US business coupled with our margin expansion we intend to boost investment in resources in the US including an AIP and specific defense opportunities. While we expect expenses to ramp starting in Q2 through the back half the year remain focused on calibrating expense growth below Revenue growth for the full year in order to continue delivering on our goals of sustained Gap profitability and GAP operating income. In the first quarter we generated Gap operating income of 81 million representing a 133% margin our fifth consecutive quarter of Gap operating income and fourth consecutive quarter of expanding Gap operating margins. We generated first quarter Gap net income of 106 million representing a 17% margin our six consecutive quarter of Gap profitability. First quarter adjusted earnings per share was 8 cents and GAP earnings per share was 4 cents. Additionally our combined revenue growth and adjusted operating margin accelerated to 57% in the first quarter a three-point increase to our rule 40 score from the prior quarter. We will continue to strive to maintain this exceptional balance of top and bottom line performance. Turning to our cash flow in the first quarter we generated 130 million in cash from operations and 149 million and adjusted free cash flow representing margin of 20 and 23% respectively. In q1 we also repurchased approximately half million shares as part of our share repurchase program as to the end of the quarter we have approximately 990 million remaining of the original authorization. We ended the quarter with 3.9 billion in cash cash equivalence and short-term US Treasury Securities. You retain access to additional liquidity of up to 500 million through our evolving credit facility which remains entirely undrawn. Now turning to our outlook for Q2 2024 we expect revenue of between 649 and 653 million and adjusted income from operations of between 209 and 213 million. For full year 2024 we're raising our Revenue guidance to between 2.67 s and 2 . 689 billion. We are raising our us commercial Revenue guidance to an excess of 661 million representing a growth rate of at least 45%. We are raising our adjusted income for operations guidance to between 868 and 880 million. We continue to expect adjusted free cash flow of between 800 million and 1 billion and we continue to expect Gap operating income and net income in each quarter of this year.

then you have a cost base in this company in five 6 7 8 9 10 years that is way closer to the bottom without timing the market at all simple as that.

but you know the odds at 70 or 80% I would give him half of that that's all now what he just said here is very simple it's a very compelling argument which is look you guys are seeing all this goodness that's coming up in 2024 I get it but guess what back in 1972 back in 1998 and back in 2007 most of the market most of Wall Street most of analysts did not see the subprime the docon bubble right now the economy is doing well because there's a lot of consumer spending now that consumer spending is fueled by a lot of borrowing a lot of debt it's some point that will is going to dry out and then we're going to see the impact on the economy it might take a couple of years it's not as instantaneous as certain people expect and he also made one more point which is a soft lending may given what Jamie Diamond just said given what Tom Lee just said a couple days ago now Tom Lee is a qualified guy he got a lot of things right over the past few years Jamie Diamond definitely knows what he's talking about and he's previewed to a lot of information about the macro about his customers so when you have these two goats coming in with complete opposite predictions about 2024 Tom Lee is bullish Jamie Diamond is bearish and they both make compelling arguments where do you as an investor take this because this is literally two experts telling you the opposite observation about the situation of the market but oddly enough there is a solution to this problem and it's quite elegant it's quite simple in fact it's quite simple in its Elegance or it's quite elegant in its Simplicity you choose and that solution is proven to work last year I thought the economy is going to go to the toilet I thought that the stock market is going to crash obviously couldn't be more wrong about that prediction and somehow despite getting every single prediction wrong about the market about the macro about anything possible Super Bowl NBA Finals everything somehow despite all of that despite being the Stephen A Smith of the stock market in 2023 my portfolio did over 100% from January of 2023 up until a few weeks ago so let's get to it and let's start with rule number one

title: Jamie Dimon Leaves Entire CNBC Panel SPEECHLESS
excerpt: Now rule number two time is the best friend of a great business and the worst friend of an empty calorie hype company now there's plenty of examples Lucid Lordstown Nicola etc etc etc there's also plenty of other examples Tesla paler and many many others Nvidia now I think paler is the greatest example of that of how time cured all these complaints about the company at the same time when companies like Lucid like nicka like Lordstown they started out here and ended up here pener went through a lot of pain a lot of negative sentiment but guess what over the course of few years what happened is the fundamentals actually beat out the bad sentiment the noise at the end of the day the longer time frame you're looking at at a company the more you're going to learn about their fundamentals so if you've invested in a company it has good fundamentals it doesn't matter what the sentiment is about the company in the short term great example of that right now is Google everybody's hating on Google mainstream media is telling you the stock is dead the search engine is going to be disrupted by AI their AI is garbage Gemini is bad Bard was even worse etc etc etc and I get the concerns but guess what the fundamentals of Google are actually a lot better than what people are telling in mainstream media when there's a lot of negative sentiment a lot of negative hype you're going to see opportunities in theet market and those opportunities is where the Sharks and the pros they came in they don't come in on the high spots and when everything just already went parabolic that's the important part time is your best friend if you've invested in a good company that's why I mean you have to do the research you have to look at fundamentals you have to understand what you're doing you can't just buy stocks because they're hype if you're buying inv video right now hoping to sell it in 3 months because the price will go up that's literally the definition of the greater fool Theory and guess what most of the time the foood is going to be you it's not going to be the pros and the Sharks 80% of the money in the market is professionals you are the 20% and you will be pushed around trust me do not play that game

title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp Proves Doubters Wrong
excerpt: Hey this is Tom and over the past few years you know being a Palantir investor after earnings was not always an easy experience not today, today we're talking about great earnings great results and absolutely a fantastic quarter by Palantir. Now the stock is up 18% as of the making of this video, Palantir is up 115% over the past year which is a very impressive number. The earnings per share was in line, the revenue was a beat with 20% growth and really really good guidance, also completing five consecutive quarters of GAAP profitability which puts Palantir deep into that S&P 5 inclusion. The commercial growth of Palantir right now is 32% year-over-year, 133% quarter for quarter, that is the growth engine of Palantir. Palantir closed 103 New Deals worth 1 million or more in 2023, that is two times more than what they've closed in 2022. Palantir has easily the cleanest balance sheet in the stock market right now. Revenues are 2.25 billion in 2023 and the guidance for 2.65 billion for 2024 with 40% growth in the commercial sector. The US commercial revenue is up 70% year-over-year to $460 million, the company more than doubled its US commercial revenue in just two and a half years, that is absolutely insane. Palantir is a company that was built from the ground up to be an AI company before anybody knew what an AI company is. In 2023 Palantir held 600 Pilots of AIP and 500 boot camps, that is five times more than the previous year, the demand is insane. Palantir is going to win the AI Wars simply because they don't care who's going to have the best generative AI LLM, Palantir builds the operating system on which any platform will work, in 5 to 10 years this is going to be the biggest business in Corporate America and Palantir is going to be the Quasi Monopoly running it. Revenues are up 20%, operating expenses only up 3%, SG&A down 15%, net income goes by 300% from 33 to 100 while the revenues only go up 20%, the scalability, the margins, the gross margin up from 80 to 84%, operating income was negative 62 million last year now it's 65 million positive, cash for operations 80 million in Q4 just last year 301 million this quarter, the margin just went up from 15 to 50% in a single year. The price to sales for Palantir shows me that it's not expensive, it's still cheaper than CrowdStrike, Snowflake, Datadog, Cloudflare, Zscaler, all these companies don't have half of the potential of Palantir and they're more expensive on price to sales.

title: Why I’m Concerned about Palantir?
excerpt: okay so we need to have a real talk about palente here they got three challenges three major problems they got to solve within the next 12 months otherwise something isn't ticking. The net dollar retention for Palantir is currently 107%, which is not enough for a growth company and is currently moving in the wrong direction; it needs to get closer to 120-130% to generate more revenue growth. We're currently at 17% revenue growth, but with Palantir's price-to-sales ratio, you expect to see higher growth. Palantir is growing at 17% compared to Snowflake's 35%, yet they trade at similar multiples, making Palantir trade more like Oracle. The company's freemium model of establishing relationships first and monetizing later has to deliver results, showing increased revenue in the mid-20s percentage to justify its current valuation within the next 12 months. Item number three is the competition from Microsoft. Microsoft Fabric is a massive problem for Palantir and has to be solved within the next 12 months. The only scenario where Microsoft's strategy of driving people out of business does not work is if Palantir's product is so much superior that no amount of discounts or rebates will work. I believe Palantir will prove it, but the burden of proof is on them to show the world they are a legitimate player and won't be bullied by Microsoft Fabric. There's no need to overreact to Palantir's great earnings or S&P 500 inclusion; it's still a long way from where it needs to be and is highly volatile. If you believe in this company, you have to think long-term and believe they can solve these challenges.

title: The RIGHT Way To Invest In Stocks Like Palantir
excerpt: Yesterday, a lot of investors, specifically Palunteer investors, went into this spin cycle. The confusion was absolutely insane. The drop of this stock by 7 and a half% in a single day confuses a lot of investors. They don't know what they should do. Existing investors are basically wondering, well, should I sell out? I mean, I'm up a lot because the stock is up so big this year, and maybe this is the beginning of a correction, so maybe I should sell it all and wait to re-enter later. And new investors are now saying, well, look, maybe I should get in now. 7 and a half% drop. This is the time to buy the dip, right? What do I do? All of this confusion is unnecessary. This is not the way to invest long-term. Definitely not in stocks like Palanteer. And it's especially true for stocks like Palunteer and Tesla. This is the behavior of a stock like Palenteer, which is just one example, right? If you're trying to time pilot and find out where it's the best entry point, exit point, this is the game you're playing. I'm going to buy every month 100 shares of Palunteer just for the sake of example 100 shares each month right whatever the cost is it is what it is right cool and then you say okay so I'm buying 100 shares here 100 shares here 100 shares here and 100 shares here but whenever the stock price dips below the 52- week high below the green line right here. Whenever it's going to dip below that, I'm going to buy 200 shares. So, I'm buying 200 here, 200 here, 200 here. You see what I did here? So, and 200 here, obviously. So, whenever the stock price dips below the 52- week high, the all-time high, whatever, you decide the threshold line. Whatever you decide, it's for you to decide. I'm just using 52- week high as an example. It's actually very convenient, but you decide the line. Whenever that threshold amount gets crossed upwards, you go back 200. Whenever it goes below it, you go to 200. And you keep doing that. In fact, I'll show you by the end of the video an example of somebody who did just that and did very well in our community. What you're doing if you're using the system is you're creating a weighted average. So the palunteer cost basis which you have gets weighted averaged into the bottom because if you're buying more let's say buying X and 2X you're buying X when it's high you're buying 2X when it's low what happens to your average your average goes down so after a couple of years what you get is more investment into Palunteer complete disregard to the price no FOMO no anxiety no emotions no mental resources and your cost basis just went down because you bought twice as much when the stock was below your threshold amount. Now, I did promise you an example of how this thing works because this is, you know, might be just me blowing smoke up your ass. one of our community members, Captain Chuck. Captain Chuck, I'm going to put his stuff on the screen right now. Captain Chuck started buying Palunteer at $22. Now, what he did, as you can see on the screen right now, he was buying at $22. But as the stock price kept coming down because he had conviction in the stock, because he knew it was a good company, because he knew this company is now selling at a discount. He started buying more, more, more as the price was going down. And now he ended up with $8.7 cost. So, he started 2 years ago. two years ago with $22 per share. Two years later, he's at $8.7 per share and he did it slowly by buying more when the stock price was coming down. And now he's up massively on the stock as you can see here on the screen right now. It's not a coincidence. It's literally what Captain Chuck said on our Patreon when we asked him, "Hey, Captain Chuck, congratulations. Tell us how you did it." And basically said, "Look, you eat an elephant piece by piece." That's exactly how you invest. Long-term investing into good companies in which you have conviction in, you have confidence in slowly over time, peace meal by piece meal, slowly building your position in a weighted average situation so that you get lower cost basis at the end of the day.

title: The one thing EVERYONE is missing about Palantir
excerpt: Over the past few weeks Palantir stock has gotten an influx of a new class of investors, people who have no idea what this company is, what it does, and just want to be a part of the gravy train. Their only logic to investing is stock going up must make money. The stock is up 113% year to date, it's running up non-stop, it's red hot. A lot of existing Palantir shareholders are trying to figure out what to do in this situation. I'm here to tell you how much Palantir is worth right now today. I was the original Palantir bull on YouTube, and back in November 2020 I made my first video about it where I said, 'this is a trillion dollar company potentially'. I said it's going to be that 10 years long term, but yes, it has potential to be a one trillion dollar company and that excites me. I sort of involuntarily became kind of the face of the Palantir community. A question I got today on Discord: 'I'm trying not to have more than 50 percent of my portfolio with Palantir, but the way the stock is increasing forces me to sell some stock'. The market is about to open in 20 minutes, let's see what the stock has done today in pre-market, it's up 7.6%, my goodness. There's three options right now for Palantir investors, and I think two of them are absolutely wrong. Option number one is to sell everything, wait for the stock to come down and try to repurchase it as a long-term investor, which is wrong. The other option is to go all in and say, 'well Palantir is on the verge of going to that one trillion dollar valuation', but that's also the wrong decision because this is a FOMO run. The stock has gotten way ahead of its valuation because of this latest run. Option number three, which is the right strategy, would be to slowly build your position in Palantir regardless of the price. Set an amount which you want to invest in the next year and break it down to 12 installments every month. The idea is at the end of 10 years if you do it every year, you're going to have a sizable position, and if indeed this stock is a one trillion dollar company in 10 years, which I think it may be, then you're going to have a nice little profit. If you have conviction in it, you're not going to panic when it goes down and you're not going to be basically grueling trying to take profits when it's not even close to its potential. What's the current valuation of Palantir? I've been on record multiple times, I've always said I'm a Palantir bull, I've never sold. I had criticism for the company when they had poor earnings, but I've never changed my opinion. I don't think it's a one trillion dollar company right now. When I look at Palantir right now as an objective evaluator, it's nowhere near one trillion dollars, not even close. For Palantir to justify a $14 valuation, you have to assume that their EBITDA is going to go to 700 million in a year, which is absolutely insane to assume, and 25% annual growth which is higher than what they are right now, and interest rates coming down. More realistically, if Palantir is going to grow at 15% and interest rates are going to stay elevated for a while, Palantir is a $7.5 dollar stock. The range for Palantir right now as it stands in 2023, before it made that quantum leap, is between $7.5 and $14 per share right now today. If Palantir manages to create exponential growth in its revenues and actually go to that valuation, then this model is absolutely relevant. But as it stands today, there's no rush. If you believe that Palantir can hit a trillion dollars, you have 10 years to invest, it's not going to happen tomorrow or in a year or two years. This is a 10-year project at minimum. This latest FOMO run, 130% in six months, that's all it is – it's a flash in the pan. Don't freak out, relax, keep buying Palantir at your pace, keep dollar cost averaging like nothing has happened. Ignore the price action if you have conviction in this stock.

title: The Debt Crisis Is Coming Soon
excerpt: now look the one thing that happened last week was very interesting is the fact that Banks reported great results. now if you look at results on the bank everybody made money woohoo great right. well there's one thing I like to pay attention to as far as Bank earnings that most people don't look at I look at the balance sheet and that balance sheet is very very important because in that balance sheet I get to see a huge predictive element. but in the case of a bank there's actual predictive value there and that's what I want to look at and trust me what happened in Q4 with all U.S banks is a big huge warning sign you don't want to miss. now look the one thing that banks have to report in the balance sheet is the provision for credit losses how much the bank considers it will have to give up as far as uncollectible debt. now there's no incentive for the bank to increase this unless they absolutely have to because it makes them look much in a shitty situation than they are. now the past quarter that number have increased by 30 percent across all U.S banks 30 in a single quarter that's no laughing matter. 6.2 billion which all major U.S banks consider to be bad debt that which will probably not be collectible the banks are basically bracing for a recessionary year. now look it's not just about the banks there's other data points which we can look at to confirm what the banks are telling us. but look at what I'm saying the banks are increasing their Provisions the credit in the US on the consumer side is actually getting bigger and bigger getting to that Boiling Point.

excerpt: what the hell is going on with Tesla right now this stock is down 70 year to date oh my goodness what A bad month what A bad year it is up today by almost two percent but goodness gracious now in this video I'm going to answer a question that a lot of you are wondering because a lot of you have Tesla stock or considering investing or considering to sell whether it's the right time to sell the right time to buy or just the right time to keep holding on. The only person that I've seen in the news right now from the high profile investors that are still loading up heavily on Tesla at this point it's Kathy Wood. I'm not even sure that it's good for Tesla that she's buying so much because she's already kind of becoming the negative Catalyst or the negative indicator for any stock she touches. Look fundamentally speaking the first thing you have to look at is price to earnings with Tesla. Price to earnings with Tesla have traditionally been you know unhinged from from fundamentals and rightfully so I think still it is hands down the best company in the stock market right now easy but the problem is that even though it's currently at a historically low PE of about 30 and forward p is actually even sub 30. Even though you know for Tesla 30 is low it's not an objectively low number in this bear market so this is not some automatic indicator where you mortgage your house and buy more Tesla stock NOW. Unfortunately for long-term Tesla investors I have bad news for you this isn't going to change in the next couple of years. Tesla will keep suffering from that, especially when Tesla still doesn't have a 27 28 000 car to compete with the Toyota Corollas and the Honda Civics and whatnot. How low can Tesla drop because if the next couple of years is going to be tough I want to explain to you what is the downward exposure I'm bullish on Tesla I'm a long-term investor but you have to understand that if you are staying for the next couple of years it's going to be a bumpy ride. If the Fed decides to continue with its restrictive monetary policy for longer this is probably a huge exposure that you have to accept as a long-term investor in Tesla. If you're not willing to accept the possibility of losing another 50 on your Tesla stock from this point on in the next two years probably not a good idea for you to invest. Why not just sell and wait two years and repurchase Tesla? This is definitely not the right time to go into margin, definitely not a stock like Tesla which will be erratic in the next couple years. If you're that sort of person and Tesla is very very interesting I'm not gonna lie look at the numbers here and they have some of the data here it's very interesting so this stock is phenomenal. It has 21 billion in Revenue in the previous quarter It produced 350 000 cars last quarter and it's it beat expectations again seven and a half percent beat above expectations on revenue ebitda is up 68 revenue is up 56 percent. The EV Market the global EV Market is expanding even though they have more competition but there's more you know more time more total market so how low do you think it will go in the recession will it take a hit most likely I mean it's probably not going to keep growing like this if the market is going to go absolutely soft but ask yourself this question if we are talking about a 20-year strategy who's going to be around in 20 years and who's going to be actually dominant is it going to be Ford or GM or any of these companies or it's going to be Tesla? It's very hard to build an argument why Tesla is not one of the best companies in the world right now. You might make an argument that Tesla's stock is too expensive you might make an argument that the recession is going to wreak havoc on its supply chain and its demand you might make an argument that the stock might drop lower and you will be able to pick it up cheaper. I think trying to time this company is just not a good idea. If you do not think that Tesla is a generationally great company at least like a top five company in the world right now this is not a good time to speculate on the stock. If you think that this company is probably I would say in the top five companies right now to invest in and you have money to lose which is not going to bankrupt you and you're willing to stay the course for the next 20 years then this is a very interesting opportunity you should look into. The fear I'm seeing in the market right now as far as Tesla stock seems to be more psychologically driven than anything fundamental even though you might make an argument about a recession slowing down Tesla but how much do you think is going to slow down I mean this company is kicking but. Do not make a decision based on psychology or fear or greed it's always a bad idea to fall more into a stock and this is a bad idea to sell into panic try and analyze the stock fundamentally and try to figure out if this is a good investment for your 20-year plan based on what it's doing based on what is planning based on the numbers look at the ebitda look at their financials look at their plans try to figure out what they're doing as far as their Tam expansion more plans Battery Technology production technology.

title: The Real Estate Crash 2023
excerpt: more importantly does this mean that the next Real Estate crash is now inevitable well you're not going to like my answer because what happens to the real estate market is going to be heavily impacted by the monetary policy of the Federal Reserve at least in the next couple of years generally they have an inverse relationship meaning that when one goes up the other tends to go down and vice versa I'm sure you all have friends like that now low interest rates have always been very accommodating to mortgage takers it's quite simple right when interest rates are low potential home buyers get to borrow more money at a cheaper rate which naturally drives up demand for housing and increases prices this party mode causing the housing market to absolutely unhinge from fundamental analysis and valuations has to end at some point because like any other party at some point it has to come to an end and that end usually happens when the script flips and the interest rates start climbing then the borrowing becomes much more expensive which reduces demand and drives down real estate prices now when Paul volcker took over the chairman of the Federal Reserve in 1979 the United States was battling one of the worst cases of inflation in history volcker believed that raising interest was the necessary evil it would make borrowing more expensive and will surely slow down the rate of economic growth in the US but it would also reduce inflation significantly so he kept raising and he kept raising all the way to 20 interest in 1981. Now volcker's actions made him an absolute Legend the rate of inflation which was at around 13 in 1971 fell to just three percent in just two years although the US actually went into a deep recession title: How to invest in a bear market
excerpt: s p 500 is down 23 so far... by focusing on the S P 500 and a few select boring stocks and by letting it write out the storm patiently smart people create Financial Security for ages now over the course of its existence the S P 500 had good years it had bad years it had horrible years it had amazing years but guess what on average it provided investors with about eight percent returns per year. Don't believe me check pull up the S P 500 chart right now and zoom out five years 10 years 15 years 20 years 25 years see for yourself. Now if you're 20 years old right now and you put in a hundred thousand dollars in the S P 500 right now even if you don't add a single dollar you just keep it there by the time you retire at 65 years old you're gonna have 3.2 million in your portfolio without adding a single dollar of capital into this thing the whole time. Now what happens if you invest the same a hundred thousand dollars when you're 20 but you add in 200 every single month, you can afford it right? Well most people can by the time you retire you can go out from 3.2 million to 4.1 million dollars by another 200 per month that works whether you're 20 30 40 or 50 doesn't matter. Let me show you, let's say you're 50 years old and you say that a hundred thousand dollars that's not enough to retire right? It's a lot of money but not enough to retire but what if you put that hundred thousand dollars into the S P 500 right now and you keep it there for 15 years until you retire at 65. And you add in 500 per month. In that case upon retirement you're going to have half a million dollars. Simple investing during a bad Market is not easy, there's a lot of emotions, there's a lot of fear, there's a lot of stress, but if you invest like that if you stay disciplined if you stay consistent you stay patient the data shows you're going to make money no matter how good or bad the market is in certain years. Now does it mean you have to invest strictly in the S P 500 because I use that as an example? Hell no that's not necessarily true. Obviously I have a lot of s p 500 in my portfolio but to each their own. The data shows that a healthy mix of ETFs indices and individual stocks actually adds some more Firepower to your portfolio while keeping the risk to a reasonable level so why not? In fact a lot of people will tell you that diversification like that by doing S P 500 stocks and a bunch of ETFs is actually going to mitigate a lot of your risk.

title: Tesla's Amazing Q3 Earnings (and Some Signs of Concern)
excerpt: so let's talk about the Q3 earnings from Tesla and yes I know there's 150 different YouTubers who already reacted to it but I wanted to take my time and purpose I want to slow down digest it all and provide you with a deeper analysis instead of the usual quick and shallow breaking news style coverage we usually get on YouTube now I mean no disrespect to any of the other creators but it's simply not something I want to offer on my Channel I want to provide more of an in-depth value with my commentary now look first of all I gotta say I was genuinely impressed by Tesla's Q3 results now don't get me wrong this was far from a perfect quarter for musk and crew but we knew coming into the quarter they missed deliveries by four percent now we know what was the impact which was the two percent Miss on revenues now Tesla did beat earnings per share by four percent and the strong dollar must have had a negative impact on revenues but that didn't matter when you are the world's largest automobile manufacturer at least by market share and you are being priced for Perfection and you missed revenues that's gonna hurt which is exactly what happened when Tesla shares dropped and after hours yesterday and today during trading now the real question which nobody seems to worry about on mainstream media is how good or bad are the actual results beyond the slide Revenue Miss beyond the slight earnings per share beat so let's take a deeper look and find out now first let's start with the numbers golly Automotive revenues went up by 55 year over year 28 quarter of a quarter all the way to 18.6 billion dollars regulatory credits remain low at 286 million with a 17 decline quarter of a quarter and a slight three percent increase year over year pretty much flat now what's actually quite impressive is the Tesla achieved a 54 Revenue increase with just two percent of extra operating expenses up to 1.7 billion that's it now that is why the income from operation is up 84 year over year of course from 2 billion to 3.7 billion now this company is getting more efficient by the quarter and you can see it across the board even in metrics like the ebitda margin which went up by 55 percent year over year of course from 3.2 billion all the way to 5 billion dollars now that's even without mentioning the net cash from operation going up by 5 billion dollars during the quarter not to mention Tesla sitting on 21 billion of dollars in cash all that with virtually no real debt I can't think of a company that's more prepared for hard times and the recession and increased rates than Tesla right now now as far as the cars themselves let's talk about it the model S and X production is still very very slim but it did grow 123 year over year with 20 000 units out in Q3 now model 3 and model y on the other hand those are wrapping up quite nicely all the way to 345 000 units which represent about 51 year-over-year growth now what's interesting and often gets overlooked at least on the mainstream media side is what's going on with the supercharger Network now during Q3 Tesla went up to 4300 stations 39 000 Chargers that's a 32 year-over-year increase in one of its major selling points over the competition whatever that is the number are absolutely terrific we knew that right but all of that is already priced in into the current share price the market knows exactly what the present is we all know Tesla is a great company but what about the future based on these earnings is Tesla actually still massively undervalued despite its huge PE well that would depend on how you answer these following two questions and this is where the beef is going to be between the Bears and the Bulls so let's talk about it let's talk about future projections now this seems to be the Battleground between the bullish and the bearish analysts of Tesla and I find it quite peculiar so Tesla said in the earnings call that they expect a 50 annual growth year over year in the next few years which may sound ambitious at first especially given the fact that we're about to hit a massive recession interest rate hikes the current state of affairs of the economy isn't that great so isn't the current share price outrageously High well let's actually examine this without emotions let's look at the numbers so the question is can Tesla sell and produce enough cars to justify a 50 annual growth guidance is that growth actually reasonable given the current market share giving the recession around the corner can Tesla keep this level of demand going even when loans are getting more expensive even when discretionary spending is actually going down and can it even actually produce all these cars assuming they can sell them now obviously even for a company like Tesla a 50 annual growth over the next two years is a very ambitious goal and some of it is already baked into the share price but not all of it let me explain with this valuation any bump in the road is going to have a heavy impact on the share price as we saw what happened two days ago when the share price actually plummeted because of a few percentage points of mess on revenues even though everything else was basically firing on all cylinders so you should be aware of that if you are an existing or potential Tesla investor this stock is priced for Perfection and anything short of that is going to be very painful for you as a shareholder you got to acknowledge that before you jump in now as far as numbers go let's start with production capacity in other words can Tesla increase production that fast well in Q3 Tesla produced 365 000 Vehicles which is a massive 54 increase year over year so as it stands now Tesla definitely can produce at a level that will support a 50 annual growth now based on the card production Pace from Q3 at least this is currently operating at a 1.5 million vehicles on a trailing 12-month basis meaning that if you multiply this quarter by four you get about 1.5 million cars on an annual basis and that's with two factories far from Full capacity so imagine what happens when these two factories Austin and Berlin actually go fully operational that's definitely more than enough to support a 50 annual growth at least for a few more years so I wouldn't call BS on Tesla being able to produce at a 50 annual growth rate now what's the real question here isn't the production base or the production capacity is the demand can we reasonably assume that Tesla will be able to sell enough cars to support a 50 increase that's the real question because if the answer is no that's the shareholders are in the World of Pain now first of all Tesla is no longer the only EV manufacturer in the world let's face it there's no point in lying to ourselves right the competition is still far from brilliant but it's slowly getting better and we can't just ignore that and hope it just goes away if you're a Tesla fan right it will have an impact on Tesla's demand that's just natural beyond that there's only so much fifty thousand dollar cars you can sell around the world there's 80 million cars being sold annually around the world the average selling price 28 000 Tesla's cars are selling at Double that give or take so you can probably push out three four million cars out of the 80 million being sold globally but that's pretty much where it ends if you want to sell 10 12 15 million cars you got to do two things if you're Tesla in the next five years number one you gotta lower the price of the model 3 and the model y can it be done possibly yes because look battery costs are still coming down inflation is slowing down Supply chains is easing up and Tesla has shown real Excellence at pushing down costs and increasing margins at least in the past so I wouldn't just say there's no way for them to reduce prices it's possible but the more important element here and the second part is that Tesla absolutely has to develop a competitor and the thirty thousand dollar category there has to be a thirty thousand dollar Tesla option at least something close to that even the thirty five thousand dollar will be suitable now the good news are they got about two or three maybe even four years because they can probably sell two or four million cars a year even with just the model 3 and the model y x and S out there so they got the timeline to get it done and that's enough time for them to roll out an affordable kind of a four-door or a kind of a Corolla competitor for the global market now Tesla doesn't have a demand problem right now in fact right now it can't make enough cars to meet existing demand so that might change in the future but as far as card demand it's still extremely strong and should remain strong at least for a few more years so therefore my conclusion here is very very simple 50 future annual growth based on what we know right now is still a legitimate claim by Tesla it doesn't mean that this is guaranteed but it certainly means that it is possible and even probable

title: The Saudi’s Revenge
excerpt: so let's talk about OPEC the organization of the petroleum exporting countries also known as the oil cartel now it is headquartered in Austria but trust me there's nothing Austrian about it there's a lot of countries there but none of them are Austria now the sole purpose of this cartel which produces about one-third of the world's oil is to coordinate oil prices by increasing and decreasing production you know they make more the prices go less they make less the prices go more you know it's a simple lever you control the price of oil by increasing and decreasing production now in 2016 something interesting happened all prices were very low so the 13 OPEC members actually joined forces with 10 other oil producers to create OPEC plus even better cartel right a group of 23 title: The FED Is About To Make The Most Expensive Mistake In History
excerpt: hey this is tom nash and yesterday the eight minute speech by john powell out of jackson hall wyoming cost the world's richest people 80 billion dollars... john powell wants to be paul volcker but at this point he's much closer to the joker because everything we've seen from this man last year is an absolute joke... jerome powell is having a bad career... so he came out yesterday and he said look inflation is still very high 40 year high this is my priority he's trying to damage control this whole transitory debacle kerfuffle he had last year and so far he's not doing a bad job at it and honestly he's not wrong because what he's saying is absolutely true the inflation levels are still insanely high... john powell being the fed chair of the big banana in the room has to set the policy right so he came out there he said hey i'm still hawkish i'm going to be the responsible adult in the room i'm going to make the tough unpopular decisions because this is what we need... the federal open market committee's overarching focus right now is to bring inflation back down to our two percent goal restoring price stability will take some time and requires using our tools forcefully to bring demand and supply into better balance while higher interest rates slower growth and softer labor market conditions will bring down inflation they will also bring some pain to households and businesses and you know what i absolutely respect what he said and i admire his goal but the real question here is will he be allowed to do what he actually wants to do or will some powerful people with a lot of money and clout start to mess with his plan... on the one hand we have the federal reserve which is supposed to be insulated it's supposed to be a hundred percent independent in its decision making... we want the fed to have its own role to do whatever it thinks professionally needs to be done without any political influences... there's a lot of influences that can trickle into this system and actually impact the decision making of the fed... elizabeth warren actually go at powell saying well you're about to drive the economy off the cliff... many many voices that are now starting to creep out into the decision-making process of the fed... if you are the fed chair and you are independent but you have people with obscene amounts of money basically telling you hey you slow down you're killing us and the other hand you have politicians who are basically telling you hey you're going to drive the economy off the cliff and they're all pressuring you to ease up and then i hear the sentence yesterday saying hey after september we might ease up i start to think whether the fed can withstand this avalanche... and the craziest part about this whole story is what i think is happening here because i think john paul and his team knew how bad inflation was and they kept calling it transitory for a long time while the entire world around them was taking on fire because of political reasons i think john powell was concerned about his reappointment long term and he was basically keeping this transitory alive from political pressures now we're on the opposite side now he completely changes tune and there's new pressures coming up about slowing down the quantitative tightening now we already have a bad record for mr powell and his team by them caving and absolutely giving up and calling this transitory for a whole year... assuming he knew this wasn't transitory he already failed to withstand political pressure once now it's going to be even worse... can this man withstand and not slow down because let me tell you one thing if he buckles under the pressure yes we'll probably have a sweet rally until then of the year but then inflation will be back and it will be back with the vengeance and it's going to be a runaway train which no amount of interest rate spikes will be able to stop we're going to see absolute avalanche of a storm in our economy and the stock market so yes it's going to be like drinking a few beers in the beginning you're having fun everything is great but then you're vomiting on the floor so i hope this doesn't happen but i'm very concerned with what i heard about the innuendo about what happens after september i'm very concerned when i hear people like elizabeth warren who actually has a big voice right now and i'm concerned by seeing billionaires lose so much money in such a short time frame.

title: Be Very Careful. This is NOT Investing
excerpt: so mc's you preferred sure class ape is now trading on the new york stock exchange and while it's certainly a funny story it has a dark side that nobody else is talking about now look when i was 14 years old i had an idea a barber shop and a car wash you know you get your fade while your car gets a new shine unluckily i realized it was a stupid idea and moved on but that is not the case for amc remember amc the cinema chain that bought literally gold mine just a few months ago they're at it again and this time they mean business i mean this time it's for real get this amc the cinema chain just launched a new preferred chair class called ape and it actually began trading after being distributed to shareholders as a dividend last week now before you say anything ape is a serious acronym it's not a meme play no no no no no ape actually stands for amc preferred equity so why did amc shares drop down 42 yesterday confused well so am i but here's what happened now these ape units were distributed as dividend last week but instead of a cash dividend shareholders got stuck now it's pretty much like a stock split for all these purposes only difference is that this is a different class of stock but the results are the same existing investors of amc get additional stocks per eta to every share they own before the dividend and since each ap unit may be converted in the future to one common share of amc this is exactly like a two for one split but with better branding and here is where i have a big big problem with what amc just did now technically this stock split should have reduced the price of amc stock like any other split except tesla of course but it didn't quite work like that and the reason is quite suspect now this so-called special dividend is clearly a retail play and whenever i hear direct attempts to appeal to retail investors i stay away i think that adam aaron the ceo of amc is doing here a very questionable act now i love i love the dedication of the ape community these guys are some of the coolest smartest people i've had the pleasure to interact with other past two years but having said that when i see a company trying to take advantage of that use this passion to mark a new security specifically to dedicated retail investors that for me is a no-go that's a red flag and i'm here to warn you now look giving away free popcorn exclusive screenings for apes fine with me but this this is a whole different animal right here and i got a serious problem with that i think what's going on here is actually a setup for a bait and switch now look adam aaron has always said to you guys the ape community i will not delude existing shareholders and obviously the first eight units were distributed for free i get that but hear me out if you read the fine print what just happened you will find out that amc clearly says that it reserves the right to sell more of these so-called ape units in the future in fact up to 1 billion units in total can be issued and no shareholder approval will be needed from this point on this means that amc can literally sell 500 million more ap units just the same amount it pretty much just gave away and that is literally what the definition of delusion is and when the company is doing the opposite of what they swore not to do i tend to stay away now i don't like what adam aaron the ceo is doing here i also don't like what he's doing on twitter either not good news for doubters that's what he tweeted a few weeks ago talking about this ape situation makes me really angry because he's taking advantage of people dedicated people which doubters mr aaron sent clear to me since except the ape community nobody really cares about your dead cinema chain amc nobody cares it has a 70 retail ownership very relevant to no relevance to professional money managers but i guess creating a common enemy is one way to raise capital for a failed business in a failing industry with billions in debt and no real plan to get out of this mess amc has more debt than city world which we will get to in this video in a second and they're actually raising money at these valuations now look i love cinema but the truth is that the cinema industry isn't a big big mess not the fault of amc but that's the situation they have that's the hand they've been built and amc is no different than any other chain yes we had some great movies this year maverick wow a lot of them did well in the box office but generally speaking hollywood is so far up their own ass basically going down the woke culture rabbit hole i don't think they're capable of making good movies at least at scale anymore it's just garbage i mean cinema chains are only as good as what hollywood produces and for the most part except few good movies hollywood has been producing pretty much look cineworld who owns the regal cinema chain just announced that it is considering fighting for bankruptcy so things are far from getting better and as the economy is getting worse we're getting more into recession discussions spending like going to movies are going to take even bigger hit and unfortunately the bottom line here is very simple amc has played this meme stock craze to the max increasing shares outstanding by 400 percent literally cashing in on this ape community sure the funds from selling ape units in the future which i'm sure they will will help imc reduce its debt in theory that is because last time they had some money adam aaron went out and bought a freaking gold mine literally gold mine so i'm not sure i even trust this car management to make the right decisions for the business and speaking about the business where is it going long term fortunately nowhere the stock market is full of investment opportunities no offense but if you really think that the best investment you can find in the stock market is amc maybe you should stick to investing in index funds like the s p 500 now no offense to the amc community no offense to retail investors i love you all but whenever i see a ceo in the company take advantage and try to cash in on that i'm gonna save my piece i'm gonna call it like i see it see you next title: China has NOTHING left
excerpt: according to recent publications chinese president xi jinping is going on a very interesting road trip president xi jinping is expected to make a visit to saudi arabia this week a number of economic agreements could come from that visit. So does this mean china is taking over the world? The question here is basically does china have the skill set to basically dethrone the world's biggest superpower the united states? Up until 40 years ago china was so isolated it was absolutely in shambles running in archaic centralized economy that was basically driving the country into the ground. About 40 years ago china initiated a major reform that absolutely led to the complete liberalization of its economy, opened itself up to foreign trade and foreign investments and allowed for free market reforms. China became one of the world's largest fastest growing economies with double-digit annual gross domestic product growth. Despite its impressive gdp numbers, china remains a poor country dealing with severe existential threats, no real capacity or desire to dominate the world. Based on per capita gdp, china is below the global average and is ranked 79th in the world so contrary to appearances china is no economic juggernaut. So much has collapse within china that the domestic economy is nowhere to be found, especially in the private sector where the only store of wealth the middle class had, the property sector, has completely collapsed. China's economy kept maturing, its gdp growth kept slowing down significantly. The chinese government has been consistently rolling back economic reforms and trade urbanization embracing a centralized economy. Years of boosting growth through debt finance infrastructure and real estate investments are now blowing up in china's face. China's refusal to allow companies listed in the us to be audited by the pcaob is putting a massive delisting sword over the same companies and scares away foreign investments. The chinese real estate market was going through the roof and now it's literally falling apart, with millions of homeowners in over 90 cities in china literally refusing to make mortgage payments. China's battle against demographic decline is not going so well; the median age of chinese citizens will be 50 years old within the next 30 years and 30% of the entire chinese population will be 65 and older by 2050. China is nowhere near to be viable as far as a threat to us and won't be for many years to come.

title: China has NOTHING left
excerpt: Will china become the global superpower which will dethrone the us? Obviously the us is not what it used to be policy mistakes over the last few decades basically caused the us to absolutely decline and cost a lot of players to look at the top spot with interest. China is often talked about as the next in line to inherit the top position from the us which has a gdp of 21 trillion dollars. The united states is at the top position with 24% of global gross domestic product. The us suffers from a very similar issue but unlike china the us could literally open up the gate, new working people will come in from all around the world. There are a lot of problems with the us dollar for sure but china is nowhere near to be viable as far as a threat to us and won't be for many years to come.

title: The Twitter Acquisition - Risk Arbitrage Analysis

title: Will China save Russia? (It’s Complicated)
excerpt: welcome to another video my name is tom nash don't click nothing don't smash nothing don't buy nothing just listen in this video i'll explain to you exactly what's going on with russia and ukraine beyond the propaganda from both sides and what i think is coming next because i don't think china is about to rescue russia like everybody on both sides think let's start russia's economy is in shambles and it's been going downhill at an alarming rate since 2014 which is when the us actually started sanctioning russia for annexing crimea the russian gdp per capita went down by 35 can you imagine an economy going down 35 in eight years russia's economy is a total toilet the us has a gdp per capita of 55 to 60 thousand dollars depend on the year russia is about fourteen thousand before twenty fourteen since 2014 it's single digits it's 8 700 per capita it's abysmal it's nowhere near where western modern countries should be definitely with so much resources in the ground so he had to solve this problem now annex in crimea was hugely popular in russia and gave him a lot of boost he basically said well i'm going to use my military power to cover up my incapacity as far as economics i'm going to take my military i'm going to get a seat at the table with u.s and china because they'll have to respect me and negotiate with me after i do it so i'm going to get some clout from them i'm going to get people rallying behind the flag and forget about the fact that the economy is the toilet and i'm going to do everything while causing a rift between ukraine germany and the us ukraine is going to be mad that nobody's coming to their protection like they promised germany is going to be fighting with the us because germany would not want to sanction me because i own them because i supply most of their gas and the us would want to shellack me and this triangle of hate is going to dissolve nato so we're going to get all this in three days of blitzkrieg boom boom boom the government is gonna run away because they're crumb puppets and we're gonna take over ukraine not a single shot fired where it matters basically crimea 2.0 now obviously that didn't happen the war is now in its third week the government is still standing and most importantly the people of ukraine are not welcoming him as a savior which i thought he was sure of now because of that the military effort is costing him more and more money more and more casualties is becoming less and less popular back home in russia and he's essentially alienating himself and no longer can be considered as the liberator of ukraine they freaking hate him so even if he wins which probably seems to be the case with the amount of military power and just the sheer numbers that russia has over ukraine what's next let's say he conquers ukraine which by the way would be a monumental task if the people aren't cooperating which they're not so it's a humongous country let's see him do that first but assuming he's done that let's say he stays and occupies ukraine i mean the cost of this is going to be insane his economy can't handle that let's say he wants the puppet government if he's not there to prop up the government and he leaves the moment he leaves they're going to overthrow the government if he stays it's like him occupying the country he'll need hundreds of thousands of men on the ground to keep it going money he doesn't have so there's no realistic way for him to win here also if he actually conquers ukraine that's the worst thing that can happen to him because that means there's not going to be a deal the only way out for putin here is to sign a deal with ukraine that the west will approve because that's the only way out of these sanctions if putin beats ukraine if he i think the worst thing that could happen to putin is this government will run away if putin actually takes ukraine by force the door is closed on any removal of these sanctions but if they work out a deal then the sanctions can be lifted so putin needs the solution to come from an agreement but the problem is his military has gotten exposed for the piece of trash that it is and he has no achievements on the ground to leverage to an actual peace agreement that he can actually sell back home as a reasonable one so he can't do the peace talks until he has some achievements but the military is just total doodoo so now the military is resorting to bombarding civilians which is alienating the local population even more and pushing the settlement even further so he's trapped and now even his own minister of finance is saying well half of our assets our foreign reserves are frozen we can't access that now the other half is pretty much also very heavily leaning on gold and that 130 billion that he has in gold it's not that liquid you know gold markets are just not as liquid as equities as you would think moving that much gold is going to be impossible probably he could move anywhere from 5 to 10 to 15 of his gold reserves in the next let's say two months and even that is going to crash the gold market because it's going to be dumping all this gold in the market the price is going to crash basically rendering his own gold pretty much worthless so he's stuck there's no money coming in except from gas oil and commodities which is a lot of money still because everybody still needs his gas all in commodities but it's not enough money to do anything but survive he still needs much much much more foreign currency to keep the ruble afloat the russian bank the russian central bank needs a lot of foreign currency to prop up the ruble and with access to foreign currencies blocked by the eu and the us he's basically locked out out of the only instrument he has to save the ruble from crashing which is exactly what's happening right now the ruble is crashing inflation is going through the roof the economy is falling apart russia is headed to bankruptcy so how can he get out of it well a peace agreement would be nice i don't know if that's in the cards it doesn't seem like it the other option for him is basically to have china step in and save his ass but here's why china is a complicated solution which i don't think he has well for first look if china saves his ass look at what he went through he went through all of this craziness to lose the entire cloud of the eu which is now completely disengaging from him it's basically unifying under nato sweden denmark all these countries finland are trying to join nato so nato is uniting he's getting isolated he's getting cut out from europe and mainly that's the crazy part that europe is militarizing and talking about diversifying out of russian gas in the next 10 years so you're losing clout in europe from being the guy in europe into being owned by china if china saves russia china basically owns russia they're the only option as is this but even that even that shitty option is not really on the table i'll explain why look president xi and putin are best friends forever the bromance is so strong it's as good as it's ever been but it's meaningless because all about interest china has to play this very very carefully they have to say the right things or putin is right nade are the bad guys and we support putin but you guys should all just get along you notice this they're staying neutral they're saying all the right things to be nice to put in but they're staying neutral because they don't know how the chips are going to fall and they don't want to find themselves on the wrong side of history because they don't know what putin might do so they're not supporting him fully now the other part is that you know china is a net exporter and they have a huge market in the us they have to tread very very carefully they don't want to get sanctioned by the us and basically cause a cluster freak internally for russia that's not something they're interested in now also look china beyond this whole thing is also in a really bad situation right now internally china much like the us is going to pay much more for gasoline and for oil and for gas now while the us can pretty much take it and people are not going to like it for china that means potential local instability that means potential loss of power for xi they can't afford it so china is now slowly moving away to this camp of understanding well this war is costing us a lot of money and potentially putting our own government at risk because of elevated prices of oil we have to get them to find a deal so china is not going to cut off ties with putin they'll still say you know the lip service about how nato is wrong but i think china at this point is much more interested in pushing putin and ukrainians into an arrangement that finishes this mess rather than providing weaponry to russia so that's why i think putin can't really rely on china to bail him out here
