title: The FED has a major problem…
excerpt: so we finally have the first rate hike in three years interest rates were raised for the first time since 2018 and the market pretty much took it in stride it's not to knock on john powell and his press conference i mean look he didn't crash the market which was good he didn't blame putin for february inflation like biden did which was good and he didn't say anything about inflation being transitory so you know three out of three look on the serious note we're looking at point twenty five percent rate hike now markets have been ready for this and i gotta give credit when credit is due the fed basically deserves a lot of respect they made it a very soft landing nobody was surprised and the market pretty much took it and just enjoyed the ride now the fed when credit is due we have to give them the credit they did a good job massaging the market into this now the real question remains is how much of the next interest rate hikes are priced in because that's a whole different enchilada and i'll explain basically we're looking at five or six more rate hikes this year in 2022 meaning we're gonna end 2022 with anywhere from 1.75 to 2 interest that's right now a given the fact is that we just saw 0.25 puts us on this course to 2 by end of year and the real question how much of that is priced in into the market that's a question i don't know nobody knows but let me tell you something else that is not going to be enough and i'm not talking about the 0.25 i'm talking about the 2 percent for every one percent that the fed is gonna hike we're gonna pay 200 billion in interest payments to service that debt it's a lot of money right now they just did a minimal 0.25 percent it's not that bad but as we get closer to one percent it's going to start being painful and if you just go back to a minute ago i told you we're probably looking at 12 if you really want to fix this so what's going on right now the fed has to communicate as if they have free will to do whatever they want when in fact they don't until the government fixes the problem as far as finding solutions to handle this national debt they can't really raise interest beyond you know quarter percentage points here a few quarter percentage points there they could probably go all the way up to two percent by end of year but at that point they're going to be locked out the government is the one that needs to find solutions because it needs to allow the fed to do what paul volcker did in the 70s now i'm not saying they need to raise 20 interest but i'm saying they need to be able to be at three four percent today at minimum which they can that means lowering energy prices there's a lot of stuff the government needs to start working on to allow the fed to do their job and right now none of this is being done and that's the real problem that's the haagen-dazs in the pizza these interest rates on their own are meaningless without actual solutions from the government and that's why i think the entire debate on mainstream media is lacking because nobody's talking about that point what's the government doing as far as allowing the fed to raise interest rates right now they're locked out because look if the fed raises interest rates abdu wazoo and the government didn't solve these problems it just means we need to print much more money we need to print much more money we're flooding the market again with more dollars causing more inflation so we really ain't really solving anything think about it now look it's still a nice progress at least we do have that crossing of the threshold of actually raising interest rates for the first time in three years we've managed to do that the market didn't crash hallelujah now it's time to get to work the real world that's not gonna be easy

title: Ross Gerber: "Palantir is LITERALLY the Worst Company in The World"
excerpt: palantir literally the worst company in the world literally as bad as nazi soldiers helping trump get elected that's the whole reason they were established selling your personal information to the highest bidder now imagine my surprise waking up finding out that rose gerber went to the dave lee podcast and talked briefly about palantir and in those five minutes he managed to spew so much nonsense i honestly don't know where to begin now unfortunately even though i like ross a lot and i don't want to do this to him but i'm about to knock you out i mean when you say things like that i mean where was your research i mean that's easily verifiable so let's start with the basic facts here is palantir literally the worst company in the world i don't know i don't think so personally but you may think that but let's talk about things you can check so first of all his claim was that palantir was established to get trump elected only problem is palantir was established 13 years before trump ran for presidency which means they either anticipated him running 13 years ahead of time which means they have an amazing software or that's absolutely false you get to decide which i think it's quite obvious and the second point that was brought up in the discussion is the dilution matter now this is a well-known thought about palantir and i think it could be easily avoided just by people checking data and facts now ross my guy i expected a little bit more from you now as far as dilution goes you should know this but the share count of palantir has not changed since the dpo so when the company went public they had 2.1 i think 2.15 billion shares that has not changed the reason is because when you go public and again this is a little bit disappointing because i expected him to know this especially with him being very bullish on tesla and with everything that just went on with elon basically exercising options selling stock to pay for those options but i don't remember if i ever heard ross gerber say that elon musk doesn't care about the shareholders they literally did the you know the identical thing the same thing exercise options that were given a long ass time ago sell some stock to pay for these options and move on but in the case of of tesla it's kind of a selective a little bit of a selective analysis right when alec tarp does the same thing as elon he gets called out by ross which again is something i don't understand now alex carp much like elon was granted about i think 70 million shares of volunteer when they were pretty much worthless in 2010 and 2011 exactly like elon with his batch of options now over the years i mean he spent a good decade basically building up the company and making it into what it is today these options are expiring on december 3rd so they've already expired my guy so this whole past year was basically him getting to the point where the options are about to be worthless now ellen's options are actually expiring on august next year and him selling right now is okay but alex harp literally sold the minute before the options were expiring and that somehow is wrong so basically what happens when you exercise options and in the case of alex harp he had no choice but to exercise because they were about to expire when you access options you're paying tax and quite a hefty one about 50 even though you're actually spending money to purchase these options you're not getting any money and now you're on the hook for basically the fair market value of the stock times your tax bracket which is you know as i said roughly 50 so you have to come up with this money somewhere it's a lot of money we're talking about hundreds of millions of dollars so basically what alex carp did is the same thing that ellen did submit 10b 5-1 plans sell every time he exercises sell exactly have to pay for the tax and nothing more and yet in the case of palantir this is fud in the case of tesla somehow nobody brings it up i honestly expected a little bit more i guess fairness from ross or to be a little bit more educated about basic things because i don't know what's worse he either did not understand that or he knows and yet he's being very selective about his analysis of volunteer versus tesla again not my place to judge i fully respect the guy but i just i expect it more now i do want to talk about the stuff that really i think irked a lot of people from the palantir community it is essentially the whole private information so he basically called them merchants of private information to the highest bidder yeah it's literally you know against what they stand for that is why they left silicon valley because and they're they're feud with the facebooks and the googles and and the apples is the fact they do not collect personal data in fact palantir have been on record multiple times unless you think they're lying which would be quite easy to expose because they have so many clients working with these products basically palantir have been on record multiple times saying hey we don't collect personal information we don't sell personal information and we don't move information from one client to another we have no use for personal information we don't even use it to train our ai systems we look at big chunks of data and we analyze it on the macro level to help the organization make better decisions case in point what they did with airbus the foundry platform takes all the data from all the planes flying around and basically helps guys like maintenance workers to preemptively perform a sort of little maintenance on the plane to prevent a big breakdown of the engine or for example if they want to optimize scheduling so they look at how many flights went on time how many not on time they don't look at specific john does or john smith's or whatever that went on board and where they're going and where they're headed it's meaningless to them it's pointless if you understand the platform you understand that personal personal and specific information is meaningless in the system they're looking for predictive mechanisms based on big movements of data and how things work on the macro level why would they why would they care about personal information not to mention the fact that i mean i wish they would have sold personal information like apple and facebook google they would have had 10x more revenue if they did that i mean that's probably one of the reasons that's holding them back a little bit because they won't do it and the sad part is i think a lot of people will miss out on palantir because this sort of fun seems to be very effective now i don't mind i know that the share price will catch up with the quality of the company and i'm happy to buy more at the reasonable price but i think a lot of people are missing out on volunteer because they hear guys like ross and other people basically spreading this fud about the company i don't know if it's intentional or not it's not of my business i'm just here to set the record straight about all of the issues that were brought up if you enjoyed this video please let me know below also as always don't click nothing don't smash nothing don't buy nothing i'm just here to give you the information and you know i'll see you in tomorrow's video
